## Before class

### Articles

**The R package brms (which is a Bayesian data analysis package) is used in the papers below. While it is a Bayesian technique, the output is similar to a regression output.**

-   {{< fa book >}} Liddell, T. M., & Kruschke, J. K. (2018). [Analyzing ordinal data with metric models: What could possibly go wrong?](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0022103117307746?via%3Dihub) Journal of Experimental Social Psychology, 79, 328–348. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jesp.2018.08.009

-   {{< fa book >}} Bürkner P-C, Vuorre M. [Ordinal Regression Models in Psychology: A Tutorial](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/epub/10.1177/2515245918823199). Advances in Methods and Practices in Psychological Science. 2019;2(1):77-101. doi:10.1177/2515245918823199

-   {{< fa book >}} Veríssimo, J. (2021). [Analysis of rating scales: A pervasive problem in bilingualism research and a solution with Bayesian ordinal models](https://files.osf.io/v1/resources/4m2ap/providers/osfstorage/6013ef9a75226b05015161a6?action=download&direct&version=2). Bilingualism: Language and Cognition, 24(5), 842-848. doi:10.1017/S1366728921000316

    -   {{< fa video >}} [Veríssimo Talk](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UXOdAcwUQ_DTH6apdR0qk4igkr93ZWsp/view?usp=sharing)

#### Questions

-   Describe what is meant by an ordinal variable

-   Describe how an ordinal variable can be represented using a latent continuous variable

-   What is cumulative probability?

-   List some common applications of ordinal regression in your field

-   How do you interpret the coefficients in an ordinal regression model?

-   What is the proportional odds assumption underlying ordinal regression? What do you do when it is violated?
